description: Interface Builder is an Apple Xcode component that allows developers to create application interfaces by dragging and dropping UI elements, rather than coding interfaces from scratch. Developers who are creating iOS applications can create and link multiple UI scenes together in a single STORYBOARD file. This allows them and other developers to view the app's workflows.

To create a STORYBOARD file, developers select Storyboard in the User Interface: field while creating an iOS app project. Xcode then creates a main.storyboard file. Developers can also manually add a STORYBOARD to their iOS projects at any time by selecting File → New → New File... from Xcode's menu and choosing to create an iOS Storyboard file.
